item.title: Inbox (by Google) Review
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
I got a In­box in­vite (hat tip to Daw­id Róż @dav4­dav4) and spent a day with it. The same day, I got the Ma­te­ri­al De­sign up­grade for Gmail. Let’s re­view it.

Read more… (25 paragraphs remaining — a 3 minutes’ read)

item.title: Series: Chris Warrick’s Android Adventure
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
I re­cent­ly got a brand new smart­phone. I had — pret­ty much — the world’s worst An­droid phone be­fore. The new phone is much more up­-­to-­date and mod­ern. How bad was its pre­de­ces­sor? Well, I’ll be hap­py to tell you!

In a soap opera se­ries. Haven’t done a se­ries since 2010 (and I trashed that one). I al­so haven’t blogged in Pol­ish for quite long (s­ince 2011, to be pre­cise). This is a change in both re­gard­s.

There is cur­rent­ly no sched­ule (and no fi­nal­ized con­tent), but the posts in the series are:

  1. Speek­er — my lit­tle An­droid app

Sys­tem Mes­sage: WARN­ING/2 (<string>, line 17)

Enu­mer­at­ed list ends with­out a blank line; un­ex­pect­ed unin­den­t.

2. BONUS: In­box (by Google) Re­view 2. The Four Pieces of An­droid, or why is it so frag­ment­ed 3. The An­dro-Cheap­o-­Phone 4. “A <man­u­fac­tur­er> <mod­el>, Sub­si­dized by <car­ri­er>” 5. Touch­Wiz makes no Sense: why OEM skins are evil 6. One Sys­tem Fits Al­l: Scal­ing in An­droid

The list of posts might be ex­tend­ed.

item.title: Forty Million is Nothing!
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
I’ve been busy, but I now have time to write about it: in a bit over one mon­th, Mi­crosoft sold 40,000,000 li­cens­es of Mi­cro­soft Win­dows. That is a lit­tle bit above, hm­m, noth­ing.

Read more… (3 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Sinofsky out
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Steven Sinof­sky said good­bye to Mi­cro­soft on Mon­day. Who is he, ­may you ask? The guy that pro­vid­ed us with en­ter­tain­ment for the last few months here. He was re­spon­si­ble for cre­at­ing this beau­ti­ful piece of shit that is Win­dows 8. So, he fucked shit up and quit. ­Mar­vel­lous.

So, bye Steve, and have fun fuck­ing shit up some­where else. May­be Scheißung, um, Sam­sung?

Read more… (0 paragraphs remaining — a 1 minutes’ read)

item.title: Windows 8 Commentary
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Win­dows 8 was re­leased on 2012-10-26. That is, 16 days ago. Why am I writ­ing about it now? Easy: be­cause I did not even both­er do­ing a re­view. This is just a bit of quick com­men­tary.

Read more… (8 paragraphs remaining — a 3 minutes’ read)

item.description:
On Ju­ly 16th, Mi­cro­soft re­leased a pre­view ver­sion of Of­fice 2013. Here is my re­view.

item.title: A Review of Windows 8 Release Preview.
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
Mi­cro­soft re­leased Win­dows 8 Re­lease Pre­view on Fri­day, June 1st. And I just want­ed to start a game playthrough on Sun­day. Wish me luck, as I want to do both AS­AP. Here we go again!

No­tice: Please read A Look at Win­dows 8 Con­sumer Pre­view first.

Read more… (70 paragraphs remaining — a 13 minutes’ read)

item.title: A Look at Windows 8 Consumer Preview
item.dc:creator: Chris Warrick
item.description:
As I said at the end of the lo­go rant, I re­viewed Win­dows 8. The third part of the <del>Twi­light</del> Win­dows 8 saga, and the big­gest one. I am go­ing to post more stuff about it in the fu­ture, but here it is: the Kw­pol­s­ka Win­dows 8 Con­sumer Pre­view Re­view. En­joy.

Read more… (60 paragraphs remaining — a 17 minutes’ read)
